title: New Profiles Feature - same profile looses logins each time I log in
content: This has now happened three times. I implemented the new profiles feature a few days ago, and have three profiles. The issue is that my main profile, every time I reboot my computer/open firefox forgets all my logins. I use a password manager and don't store them in firefox ; this has never been an issue before. It is happening on the same profile each time. My bookmarks/extensions stay the same. This is happening on sites even when I have clicked 'keep me logged in'. There is no site/login that is unaffected - it seems to reset my login status I want to reiterate this is all happening on the same profile - this is not an issue of logins not carrying between different profiles The only other setting I changed is auto-storing passwords on firefox [It had saved my master password accidentally, so.] But there were very few passwords actually stored there, and those sites worked before. I am on Win 11 and have had no issues previously

title: Firefox, no guarda contraseñas.
content:
Hola, Gerardo.

Gracias por tu respuesta.

Primero antes de responder a tus preguntas le digo que inicio sesión con, Chrome sin problemas sin tener que teclear la complicada contraseña, cuando inicio sesión con FireFox tengo que abrir fichero encriptado donde tengo todas mis contraseñas, copiar y pegar, obviamente este problema es porque FireFox no guarda contraseñas.

Respondo a tus preguntas. 

1) borro todas las carpetas de FireFox y limpieza del registro de Windows, con el programa Ccleaner

2) uso la cuenta de FireFox sin sincronizar. (siempre lo he hecho así, sin problemas)

3) Como bien sabes al iniciar instalación nueva FireFox dice crear nuevo perfil, clic en aceptar, Termina la instalación y el problema persiste. Antes de la actualización guardaba contraseñas. Es la primera vez que pasa este problema, llevo utilizando FireFox más de 30 años. Antes de actualizar a versión 14.03 no había problemas de contraseñas

Le envio captura de pantalla importación de contraseñas, como puedes ver se ven todas y al cerrar FireFox y abrir las contraseñas desaparecen, como puedes ver en la otra captura de pantalla

Gracias.
creator: Ramonesq4147

content: Repeatedly, repeatedly, repeatedly get SECURE CONNECTION FAILED - An error occurred during a connection to xxxxxxxx.com. Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem. There are few attempted web sites that do not get blocked with this message -- EVEN WWW.FIREFOX.COM. I've tried downloading an update to Firefox, but have problems with doing it -- have often gotten the above notice even when trying to download update! Keep getting "Update Failed". Have no trouble accessing any sites using Safari. I'm running a late 2012 21" iMac with macOS Catalina Version 10.15.7
creator: akrupp

title: Video decoding performance is significantly lower than that of other Chromium-based browsers.
content:
In Firefox, When H264 frames are decoded and rendered within a single tab, the output reaches up to 180 fps, performing well and meeting expectations. When decoding and rendering occur on two separate tabs on parallel, performance significantly drops, impacting both processes. However, it performs smoothly when running on a single tab.

In comparison to the Brave browser, H264 decoding and rendering are noticeably slower in Firefox. Firefox manages only around 180 fps, while Brave and other Chromium-based browsers can achieve approximately 1000 fps on a single tab and around 800 fps when multiple tabs are open.


Document Link : https://workdrive.zohoexternal.in/external/writer/999ecda6e3a0b1ed2d4629c8480a6c1d595764234c29563e5bc8aa530cfbc431
creator: harie20202

title: High GPU Usage in Firefox When Playing Danmaku on bilibili.com (2019 MacBook Pro)
content:
On my 2019 16-inch MacBook Pro equipped with dual GPUs, enabling danmaku (on-screen comments) while playing videos on bilibili.com causes a sudden spike in GPU usage, leading to significant heating. The issue disappears when danmaku is disabled.

Additional notes: 1. This problem does not occur in Safari or Chrome. 2. "Use recommended performance settings" is already enabled in Firefox. 3. Reinstalling Firefox did not resolve the issue.

What can I do to fix this?
